question: 1. George needs a ________.
explanation: Explanation:  Only choice (c) is a countable noun which requires an article before it. Other choices consist uncountable nouns that do not accept an indefinite article before them.

question: 2. Munro was driving a _______ when I saw him yesterday.
explanation: Explanation:  Choices (a) and (c) do not make any sense because you cannot drive a tree or an abstract idea (infatuation). Choice (d) would be correct if the verb was ‘riding’. Mercedes is a name of a car. So, you can drive a car.

question: 3. On the weather forecast, they said there would be _________ this afternoon.
explanation: Explanation:  Choice (d) is the only sensible noun to use in this context.

question: 4. The waiting room was so full of people and their _______ and there was nowhere to sit.
explanation: Explanation:  Only ‘bags’ (d) can make a room full. Other choices do not fit the context.

question: 5. Repairing car engines is easy if you’ve got the right ______.
explanation: Explanation:  Choices (c) and (d) do not fit with the context. Choice (a) can be correct but choice (b) is appropriate.

question: 6. In Stockholm, at the moment there’s a fascinating exhibition of__________ from 19th century Sweden.
explanation: Explanation:  Choices (b) and (c) do not make any sense. Choice (a) does not fit the context. Choice (d) is appropriate in this context.

question: 7. Both my brothers are looking for a _________.
8. The price of …………… has increased by 12% this year alone.
explanation: Explanation:  Only choice (c) makes sense in this sentence.

question: 9. Mary used to feed some ………….. in her garden until they started to get out.
explanation: Explanation:  We cannot see or touch ‘success’ but we can feel it. So, it must be an abstract noun.

question: 10. A score of 40% may not be very good but it’s certainly an …………….. on her last mark.
explanation: Explanation:  We cannot see or touch ‘life’ but we can feel it. So, it must be an abstract noun.

question: 11. Success
explanation: Explanation:  It’s a name for a definite person and it starts with a capital letter. So, it must be a proper noun.

question: 12. Life
explanation: Explanation:  It’s a common name for many people who have that profession. It’s a name of a profession.

question: 13. George
explanation: Explanation:  Choice (d) fits with the context and the other choices don’t.

question: 14. Police
explanation: Explanation:  Choice (d) fits with the context more than the other choices.

question: 15. I’ve had a …………… of green vegetables ever since I was a child.
explanation: Explanation:  Choice (d) fits with the context and the other choices do not.

question: 16. Our students study both ……………. and literature in their English degree.
explanation: Explanation:  Only thing that ‘builds up’ on a road is ‘traffic’. So, it must be choice (d).

question: 17. After so many previous ……………….., it was inevitable that one of his films would be unpopular.
explanation: Explanation:  ‘Government’s spending cuts’ are employed on different sectors like ‘education’, agriculture,

question: 18. I had to go through a very strict and traditional ……………….
19. ……………..was building up on the motorway as the fog got thicker.
20. ………… has been hit once again in the government’s spending cuts.
